required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Study to Evaluate Safety and Efficacy of QL-007 Tablets in Combination With Tenofovir in Naive Patients With Chronic Hepatitis b
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label Phase 2 Study to Evaluate Safety and Efficacy of QL-007 Tablets in Combination With Tenofovir in Naive Patients With Chronic Hepatitis b: a Multicenter, Randomized, Positive Controlled Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
This is an open label, randomized, multi-center, comparative study. Subjects will be screened prior to study entry to establish eligibility. 100 Subjects who meet all the selection criteria will be randomly assigned 1:1:1:1:1 to (A) QL007 100 mg QD+ Tenofovir dipirofurate fumarate （TDF）300 mg QD, (B) QL007 200 mg QD+ TDF 300 mg QD, (C) QL007 400 mg QD+ TDF 300 mg QD, (D) QL007 200 mg BID+ TDF 300 mg QD, (E) TDF 300 mg QD.
The purpose of this study was to evaluate the efficacy and safety of QL-007 in combination with TDF in HBeAg positive patients with chronic hepatitis b, and to recommend a reasonable regimen for phase III study.

detailed_description.textblock: The subjects received the drug treatment for a total of 96 weeks, which was divided into two stages: the first stage: 0-24 weeks as the core treatment period and 25-48 weeks as the extended treatment period. The second stage: 49-96 weeks is the extended treatment period，subjects will enter the second stage of treatment according to the dose of the first stage. When the efficacy data of the first phase determine the optimal dose of QL-007, all subjects entering the second phase will receive the optimal dose of QL-007 and continue treatment with tenofovir dipirofurate fumarate (QL-007 XX mg+TDF) for the second phase 49-96 weeks of extended treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the efficacy of QL-007 in combination with TDF in patients with HBeAg-positive chronic hepatitis b: HBV DNA level
primary_outcome.description: The change of HBV DNA level at week 24 of treatment compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.description: The changes of HBsAg and HBeAg level from baseline at week 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, 36, 48, 60, 72, 84, 96
The percentage of subjects with HBsAg and HBeAg serological clearance and/or seroconversion at week 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, 36, 48, 60, 72, 84, 96
The changes of HBV DNA level compared to baseline at week 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, 36, 48, 60, 72, 84, 96
The rate of HBV DNA negative subjects (HBV DNA ＜60 IU/mL) at week 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, 36, 48, 60, 72, 84, 96
The changes of ALT at week 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, 36, 48, 60, 72, 84, 96 compared to baseline
The percentage of subjects with normal ALT level at weeks 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, 36, 48, 60, 72, 84 and 96

secondary_outcome.measure: Other evaluation indexes of pharmacodynamics exploration
secondary_outcome.description: The changes of HBV RNA and HBcrAg level compared with baseline at week 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, 36, 48, 60, 72, 84 and 96

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the tolerance of QL-007 in combination with TDF: incidence of adverse events

arm_group.description: QL-007 tablet 100 mg QD was combined with TDF tablet 300mg
QL-007 tablets 200 mg QD were combined with TDF tablet 300mg
QL-007 tablets 400 mg QD were combined with TDF tablet 300mg
QL007 tablets 200 mg BID were combined with TDF tablet 300mg

overall_official.affiliation: Southern Hospital of Southern Medical University

facility.name: Southern Hospital of Southern Medical University
